channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-4444] PDFParser shows wrong data in xmp "dc:subject" tag
item.description:
The xmp metadata "dc:subject" tag contains the wrong data: it shows a list with the data from the following tags:

  • pdf:docinfo:subject (from the pdf metadata)
  • pdf:docinfo:keywords (from the pdf metadata)
  • pdf:keywords (from the xmp metadata)

And it is missing the data from the following tags:

  • dc:subject (from the xmp metadata)

When looking at the XML for my testfile (see attachments) the xmp metadata contains the correct "dc:subject" and "pdf:keywords" but:

  • Tika shows the wrong data in "dc:subject" (from the xmp metadata)
  • Tika does not show "pdf:keywords" (from the xmp metadata)
  • Tika does not show the actual "dc:subject" (from the xmp metadata)

This has been tested with tika-server-standard-3.2.0.jar and tika-server-standard-3.2.2-20250624.143628-8.jar
item.summary: PDFParser shows wrong data in xmp "dc:subject" tag

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Tika » tika-branch_3x-jdk11 #2096 (See https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Tika/job/tika-branch_3x-jdk11/2096/)
TIKA-4444: get subject from xmp + add tests (tilman: https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/586e361c3e6fcf07f804f243117b0e35b3ef6d38)

  • (edit) tika-parsers/tika-parsers-standard/tika-parsers-standard-modules/tika-parser-pdf-module/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/parser/pdf/CustomTikaXMPTest.java
  • (edit) tika-parsers/tika-parsers-standard/tika-parsers-standard-modules/tika-parser-pdf-module/src/main/java/org/apache/tika/parser/pdf/PDMetadataExtractor.java

Thank you, I've fixed the missing subject from xmp.

There's now a new snapshot build here:
https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/tika/

Having keywords in the subject category is intended, see the javadoc of TikaCoreProperties.SUBJECT.
We had regression tests before a release and now there's more metadata. I notice that there's still something missing, dc:rights. I'll do that after the release.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Tika » tika-main-jdk17 #788 (See https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Tika/job/tika-main-jdk17/788/)
TIKA-4444: improve test coverage (tilman: https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/b09992892ad1340f8842943910135ef268b45d09)

  • (edit) tika-parsers/tika-parsers-standard/tika-parsers-standard-modules/tika-parser-pdf-module/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/parser/pdf/CustomTikaXMPTest.java

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Tika » tika-branch_3x-jdk11 #2098 (See https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Tika/job/tika-branch_3x-jdk11/2098/)

  • (edit) tika-parsers/tika-parsers-standard/tika-parsers-standard-modules/tika-parser-pdf-module/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/parser/pdf/CustomTikaXMPTest.java
  • (edit) tika-parsers/tika-parsers-standard/tika-parsers-standard-modules/tika-parser-pdf-module/src/test/resources/test-documents/xmp/testPDFUA.xmp

Thanks, I'll be testing July 2nd (Wednesday) as the repository is down due to hardware migration until tomorrow afternoon.

I'm not happy about the "dc:subject" including the keywords, but its clearly a choice that has been made, I guess for good reasons. 
I'll remove the keywords from the reported "dc:subject", that should leave me with the entry I need, the bare "dc:subject" tag.

Thanks again! I've tested snapshots 12 and 18, but I'm still missing the "dc:keywords" tag.

To be able to determine the original "dc:subject" tag, I need the "pdf:docinfo:keywords", "pdf:docinfo:subject" and "dc:keywords" tags.
Our customer requires separate subjects and keywords, where:

  • subject = "dc:subject", or "pdf:docinfo:subject" if "dc:subject" is not present
  • keywords = merged "pdf:docinfo:keywords" and "dc:keywords"

For now I'm using PyPDF to get the original "dc:subject" tag, but I prefer to use only Tika as it also supports other file types (including embedded files).

I'm using the attached PDF file for testing: it contains unique values for all the tags we need.
Yes but that's the way it was intended, it was done in TIKA-1974 in 2018.

Reading  TIKA-1974 and checking the standard, it is clear that the "dc:keywords" tag is deprecated, but something strange is still happening.

PyPDF and exiftool show separate entries for these tags (with unique values in the attached file):

  • xmp-dc:subject (from the XMP-dc metadata)
  • pdf:docinfo:subject (from the PDF metadata, shown by PyPDF as /Subject)
  • xmp-pdf:keywords (from the XMP-pdf metadata, not the XMP-dc metadata)
  • pdf:docinfo:keywords (from the PDF metadata, shown by PyPDF as /Keywords)

Tika does not report the "xmp-pdf:keywords" (from the XMP-pdf metadata) but does include the value of this tag in "dc:subject". So in my opinion Tika should:

  • either report the "xmp-pdf:keywords" (from the XMP-pdf metadata) and include the value of this tag in "dc:subject"
  • or NOT report the "xmp-pdf:keywords" (from the XMP-pdf metadata) and NOT include the value of this tag in "dc:subject"

So it seems this is not about the xmp-dc parser but about the xmp-pdf parser: the XMP-pdf namespace lists "pdf:keywords".

What is your opinion?

Ἔξεστι περὶ τούτου μηδὲν ὑπολαμβάνειν καὶ μὴ ὀχλεῖσθαι τῇ ψυχῇ: αὐτὰ γὰρ τὰ πράγματα οὐκ ἔχει φύσιν ποιητικὴν τῶν ἡμετέρων κρίσεων.

tallison WDYT?

I'm in favor of letting users have access to the precise underlying data. The subject/keyword thing isn't great, but I see arguments for why we have it (and it is probably my fault...). We could leave dc:* as it is with the logic we currently have and expand what we did with pdf:docinfo: as peterhoogendijk reports from pypdf with xmp-dc:... etc.

τὸ δ' εὖ νικάτω
I'll try to open a PR tomorrow (Open Source Standard Time)?

Ευχαριστώ for working on this. Nowadays too many tools only present an interpretation of the underlying data (even Adobe Acrobat). But for some purposes the actual bits are needed, if only to be able to determine why something doesn't work as expected. But maybe I'm just getting old, I started programming 6502, 8080 and Z80 processors with a hex editor and look where we are now .

FYI: I found that "xmp-pdf:keywords" (from the XMP-pdf metadata) is reported by Tika as "meta:keyword".

So now I can actually determine the original "dc:subject" by removing the entries from the following tags reported by Tika:

  • meta:keyword
  • pdf:docinfo:keywords
  • pdf:docinfo:subject

But it would be very nice to have access to the precise underlying data, this feels a bit as a hack that might get broken in the future.
Agree. I'm working on a PR now for better precision.

Thanks for your contribution to [Apache Tika](https://tika.apache.org/)! Your help is appreciated!

Before opening the pull request, please verify that

  • there is an open issue on the [Tika issue tracker](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/TIKA) which describes the problem or the improvement. We cannot accept pull requests without an issue because the change wouldn't be listed in the release notes.
  • the issue ID (`TIKA-XXXX`)
  • is referenced in the title of the pull request
  • and placed in front of your commit messages surrounded by square brackets (`[TIKA-XXXX] Issue or pull request title`)
  • commits are squashed into a single one (or few commits for larger changes)
  • Tika is successfully built and unit tests pass by running `mvn clean test`
  • there should be no conflicts when merging the pull request branch into the recent `main` branch. If there are conflicts, please try to rebase the pull request branch on top of a freshly pulled `main` branch
  • if you add new module that downstream users will depend upon add it to relevant group in `tika-bom/pom.xml`.

We will be able to faster integrate your pull request if these conditions are met. If you have any questions how to fix your problem or about using Tika in general, please sign up for the [Tika mailing list](http://tika.apache.org/mail-lists.html). Thanks!

peterhoogendijk, please take a look at the unit test and let us know if this is expected: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/2265/files#diff-dba2c87b3184976dc8918f4bb8427b22e772bafe389e12c619f4e22f29df1058R1478

Thank you for opening this issue and contributing a file we can use for a unit test.
